etymologies: 1930s; earliest use found in Mineralogy Magazine. From the name of Prince Piero GinoriConti, Italian industrialist involved in borax mining + -ite, after Italian ginorite

definitions: A rare mineral consisting of a hydrated calcium borate, typically occurring as a surface deposit of white platy crystals.

notes.text: Chemical formula: Ca₂B₁₄O₂₃·8H₂O. Crystal system: monoclinic.
